CatDescriptText: Miss Ruth Banks, Senior, Schenley High School, 749 Clarissa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that American citizens should receive Russia's first deputy premier, Anastas I. Mikoyan hospitably, or deport themselves in unhospitable fashion like some have done in several cities where Mikoyan has visited?" answer reads: �I think that we should be hospitable and therefore show Mr. Mikoyan the United States as it is. This does not mean an overwelcome [sic].  But we should treat him with the same courtesies that we do any other foreign visitor.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruth Banks, wearing dark head scarf and long tweed jacket with light colored buttons, standing on sidewalk in front of shrubs and brick building with three arched windows
